page.title: 18VILLAGE HISTORY
page.content: Newsham village which lies on the baks of the Tees was a long narrow settlement and the largest of the deserted medieval villages in Cleveland. The village is first recorded as a possession of the Baliol family,builders of Barnard Castle in the 12th century,but an earlier beggining is likely. A continuous existence is recorded until the late 14th century when the population fell from 25 households to one household,probably because of the Black Death.If you go to Newsham Grange you will see the banks that mark the cottage boundaries.
